instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
I have another one of those nightmare retina's where the trackpad is frozen. The voltage on the trackpad pin 1 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL> is 1.56v, when I remove the trackpad cable it is 3.3v. So i replaced both the cable and trackpad but as soon as I connect the trackpad, the same happens! I also ran it without any other devices conncted (Battery, display, I/O board and SSD) but the same still happens. Any ideas? Board itself looks clean no liquid spils.

Edit: also tried another keyboard still freezes, keyboard works fine however, Apple OSD test says no issues found

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message: What is the resistance value of <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR>??

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR> was off, I made a direct line with copper wire as its 0 ohm, working fine now :)
